thread.title: Leeds parts company with coach Uwe Rosler after latest loss
thread.title_full: Leeds parts company with coach Uwe Rosler after latest loss

title: Leeds parts company with coach Uwe Rosler after latest loss
text:
Leeds parts company with coach Uwe Rosler after latest loss By -   
LEEDS, England (AP) - Leeds says that coach Uwe Rosler has left the Championship club, following a third consecutive defeat for the relegation strugglers. 
Leeds tweeted that “Uwe Rosler has parted company with the club” and that a full statement would be released later Monday. 
Saturday’s 2-1 home defeat to Brighton has left Leeds in 18th place in the 24-team second tier of English football, just three points above the relegation zone. 
Rosler was appointed in May on a two-year contract. The 46-year-old German coach had previously managed Wigan and Brentford. 
A force in domestic and European football from the late 1960s to the mid-1970s, Leeds has struggled over the past decade and the team has yet to win at Elland Road this season.
